content:
The chunk is part of a comprehensive guide on the Particle Panel in Panda3D, detailing how different renderer types are used to create specific visual effects. It explains each renderer's unique features and configurations, such as line length and color transitions, helping users customize particle effects effectively.

Particles launch away from this point in Radiate mode.

Some of this information can also be found in the Particle Emitters page.

Renderer:

Renderer Type sets the type of particle renderer. These are LineParticleRenderer, GeomParticleRenderer, PointParticleRenderer, SparkleParticleRenderer and SpriteParticleRenderer.

Alpha setting over particle's lifetime: NO_ALPHA, ALPHA_IN, ALPHA_OUT, ALPHA_IN_OUT, ALPHA_USER.

Alpha value for ALPHA_USER alpha mode.

LineParticleRenderer

LineParticleRenderer is useful for effects such as rain. You can't use the SpriteParticleRenderer for the same effect, as the lines would always face the camera. Each Particle Renderer has it's own unique options, so we are going to explain them separately.

1.1 – 1.2) Head color and tail color of the line can be different.

1.3) You can set the lenght of the line here.
